companies.name: Telstra Corporation Limited
companies.description: Australia's largest telecommunications company providing mobile, internet, and phone services

contact.hours: 24/7 for urgent issues, 8am-8pm for general enquiries

steps: Contact customer service on 132 200 or via live chat
If unresolved, request escalation to complaints team
Formal complaint lodged and reference number provided
Investigation conducted within 5-10 business days
Written response provided with resolution or explanation
internalProcess.timeframe: 15 business days for resolution

escalation.timeline: Contact TIO if unresolved after 8 weeks, or ACMA for regulatory issues

companies.name: Optus
companies.description: Major telecommunications provider offering mobile, internet, and entertainment services

steps: Contact customer care on 133 937 or online chat
Escalate to complaints resolution team if needed
Complaint registered and investigated
Resolution attempt within 10 business days
Final response provided in writing
internalProcess.timeframe: 10-15 business days

escalation.timeline: Escalate to TIO after 8 weeks if unresolved

companies.name: Commonwealth Bank of Australia
companies.description: Australia's largest bank providing retail, business, and institutional banking services

steps: Contact customer service on 13 2221 or visit branch
Request to speak with manager if unresolved
Lodge formal complaint with Customer Relations
Investigation conducted by specialist team
Written response provided within required timeframes
internalProcess.timeframe: 21 days for most complaints, 45 days for complex issues

escalation.timeline: Contact AFCA (Australian Financial Complaints Authority) if unresolved after 45 days

companies.name: Woolworths Group Limited
companies.description: Australia's largest supermarket chain and retail group

steps: Speak with store manager or team member
Call customer care on 1800 000 610
Submit feedback online via website
Complaint investigated by customer care team
Resolution provided via phone or email
internalProcess.timeframe: 5-10 business days

escalation.timeline: Contact ACCC for product safety or misleading conduct issues

companies.name: Origin Energy Limited
companies.description: Major Australian energy retailer providing electricity and gas services

steps: Contact customer service on 13 24 61
Request escalation to complaints team if needed
Formal complaint investigation begins
Resolution attempted within timeframes
Written response provided
internalProcess.timeframe: 20 business days for most complaints

escalation.timeline: Contact Energy & Water Ombudsman in your state if unresolved

companies.name: Westpac Banking Corporation
companies.description: One of Australia's major banks providing retail, business and institutional banking services.

steps: Contact customer service via phone, branch or the online feedback form
If unresolved, request escalation to the Customer Solutions team
Complaint is registered and investigated; Westpac aims to resolve most complaints within 5 business days
Written response provided outlining resolution or explanation
internalProcess.timeframe: 5 business days for most complaints; up to 15 business days for complex matters

escalation.timeline: Contact the Australian Financial Complaints Authority (AFCA) if not resolved or dissatisfied

companies.name: National Australia Bank Limited
companies.description: Major Australian bank offering retail, business and institutional banking services.

steps: Contact customer service on 13 22 65 or visit a branch
If unresolved, request to lodge a formal complaint with NAB Resolve team
A case manager investigates and aims to resolve within 5 working days
Updates provided if more time is needed and final response given
internalProcess.timeframe: 5 business days for most complaints; up to 30 days for complex issues

contactDetails.mail: NAB Resolve, Reply Paid 2870, Melbourne VIC 8060

escalation.timeline: Contact AFCA if complaint is not resolved or if dissatisfied with the outcome

companies.name: Qantas Airways Limited
companies.description: Australia's flag carrier airline providing domestic and international flights.

steps: Contact Qantas Customer Care via phone or lodge a complaint through the online form
Provide booking details and describe the issue
Qantas investigates and aims to respond within 15 business days
If unsatisfied, request escalation to a supervisor
internalProcess.timeframe: 15 business days

escalation.timeline: Contact the Airline Customer Advocate if unresolved

companies.name: Jetstar Airways Pty Ltd
companies.description: Low-cost airline owned by Qantas Group providing domestic and international flights.

steps: Call Jetstar on 13 15 38 or lodge a complaint via the online form
Provide booking reference and details of the issue
Jetstar registers the complaint and investigates; they aim to respond within 15 business days
If unsatisfied, request to speak with a supervisor or pursue further
internalProcess.timeframe: 15 business days

escalation.timeline: Contact the Airline Customer Advocate if unresolved

companies.name: Virgin Australia Airlines Pty Ltd
companies.description: Major Australian airline providing domestic and short-haul international flights.

steps: Call 1300 170 911 or submit a complaint via the Virgin Australia webform
Provide flight details and describe the issue; Virgin logs the complaint
Investigation undertaken; Virgin aims to respond within 10 business days
If unsatisfied, request escalation to a supervisor
internalProcess.timeframe: 10 business days

escalation.timeline: Contact the Airline Customer Advocate if unresolved after internal process

companies.name: AGL Energy Limited
companies.description: Australian energy retailer supplying electricity and gas to residential and business customers.

steps: Contact AGL on 131 245 (or 1800 775 329) or use the online complaint form
Provide account information and details of the issue; AGL registers the complaint
AGL investigates and aims to resolve within 5–10 business days
A written response is provided with resolution or explanation
internalProcess.timeframe: 5–10 business days

escalation.timeline: Contact the Energy & Water Ombudsman in your state if unresolved

companies.name: Coles Group Limited
companies.description: Major Australian supermarket chain and retail group.

steps: Speak with the store manager or call customer care on 1800 061 562
For online shopping issues, call 1800 455 400
Submit feedback via the Coles website if needed
Customer care team investigates and provides a resolution within 5–10 business days
internalProcess.timeframe: 5–10 business days

escalation.timeline: Contact the Australian Competition and Consumer Commission (ACCC) for consumer rights or product safety issues

companies.name: Suncorp Group Limited
companies.description: Australian financial services group offering insurance and banking products.

steps: Contact Suncorp by phone on 13 11 55 or submit an online complaints form
Alternatively, write to Suncorp Insurance at GPO Box 68, Sydney NSW 2001
Suncorp aims to acknowledge your complaint within 1 business day and resolve it within 5 business days
If unresolved, request a review by the Customer Relations Team (phone 1300 264 053 or email idr@suncorp.com.au) which will provide an outcome within 30 calendar days
internalProcess.timeframe: Acknowledgement within 1 business day; resolution within 5 business days; 30 days if escalated

contactDetails.mail: Suncorp Insurance, GPO Box 68, Sydney NSW 2001

escalation.timeline: Contact AFCA if your complaint is not resolved within 30 days or you are dissatisfied with the outcome

companies.name: Australian Taxation Office
companies.description: The Australian Government agency responsible for administering and collecting taxes and superannuation, and delivering government benefits.

steps: Phone the ATO complaints line on 1800 199 010 during business hours and explain your issue
Provide relevant details (tax file number, reference numbers) so the ATO can investigate
If preferred, send written feedback to the ATO at GPO Box 9990 in your capital city
The ATO will review your complaint and contact you with an outcome
internalProcess.timeframe: The ATO advises that it will respond as quickly as possible after investigating the matter

contactDetails.mail: Australian Taxation Office, GPO Box 9990, Sydney NSW 2001

escalation.timeline: If you are not satisfied with the ATO’s response or resolution you can contact the Inspector‑General of Taxation and Taxation Ombudsman (IGTO) via 1300 448 829 or GPO Box 551, Sydney NSW 2001

companies.name: National Roads and Motorists’ Association
companies.description: Member‑owned organisation providing roadside assistance, car servicing, travel, insurance and advocacy services.

steps: Contact NRMA by phone on 13 11 22 or submit an online feedback form with details of your complaint
You may also email member.relations@mynrma.com.au with supporting information
NRMA will assign a team member to your complaint, provide their name and phone number and keep you informed of progress
They aim to provide a final response within five business days
internalProcess.timeframe: NRMA aims to finalise most complaints within 5 business days

escalation.timeline: If your complaint remains unresolved after NRMA’s process you can contact the Australian Financial Complaints Authority (AFCA) for an independent review

companies.name: IKEA Pty Limited
companies.description: Furniture and homewares retailer offering flat‑pack furniture, home furnishings and accessories.

contact.hours: Phone available 9am–7pm AEST/AEDT daily; chat available 7am–9pm

steps: Contact IKEA customer service on 02 9010 0264 or through live chat to discuss your issue
For privacy‑related complaints or data enquiries, email data.privacy.au@ingka.ikea.com or call 02 8020 6641
Provide order details and any relevant information; IKEA will investigate and respond to your complaint
If you are not satisfied with their response you can request that your complaint be reviewed
internalProcess.timeframe: IKEA states it will respond to privacy complaints within a reasonable time and aims to resolve issues promptly

contactDetails.mail: IKEA Pty Ltd, PO Box 108, Tempe NSW 2044

escalation.timeline: If your concern is not resolved you may contact the Office of the Australian Information Commissioner (OAIC) via enquiries@oaic.gov.au or 1300 363 992

companies.name: Bunnings Group Limited
companies.description: Hardware and home improvement retailer supplying tools, garden supplies, building materials and household goods.

steps: Contact Bunnings Customer Support on 1800 797 586 for product or order enquiries
Provide details of your purchase or the issue so the support team can investigate
If the issue relates to a store purchase, speak with the store manager or complete the feedback form on the Bunnings website
Bunnings will work with you to find a resolution and may offer a refund, replacement or repair where appropriate
internalProcess.timeframe: Bunnings aims to resolve complaints as quickly as possible but does not publish a specific timeframe

escalation.timeline: If you are unable to resolve your issue with Bunnings you can contact the Australian Competition and Consumer Commission (ACCC) or your state fair trading agency

companies.name: Medibank Private Limited
companies.description: Private health insurer providing health, travel and pet insurance and health services across Australia.

steps: Call Medibank on 1300 132 331 or visit a Medibank retail store to lodge your complaint
Provide membership details and a description of the issue; Medibank will investigate and keep you informed
If unresolved, ask to speak with a senior customer resolutions specialist who will review your case
internalProcess.timeframe: Medibank advises that it will work to resolve complaints as quickly as possible

escalation.timeline: If your complaint is not resolved to your satisfaction you can contact the Private Health Insurance Ombudsman via the Commonwealth Ombudsman

companies.name: Officeworks Ltd
companies.description: Retailer specialising in office supplies, stationery, technology, furniture and educational materials.

steps: Call Officeworks Customer Service on 1300 633 423 during business hours to discuss your concern
Provide details of your purchase, order or issue; the customer service team will record and investigate
Officeworks will contact you with a resolution or request additional information if necessary
internalProcess.timeframe: Officeworks aims to resolve complaints within 5–10 business days depending on complexity

escalation.timeline: If you are unhappy with Officeworks’ response you can contact the ACCC or your state consumer affairs agency

companies.name: Australian Postal Corporation
companies.description: Government‑owned corporation providing postal, courier and logistics services across Australia.

steps: Call Australia Post Customer Care on 13 POST (13 76 78) to report your issue
Provide tracking numbers or relevant details; the customer care team will log your complaint
Alternatively, lodge your complaint through the online form on the Australia Post website
Australia Post investigates and responds to complaints, aiming to resolve them promptly
internalProcess.timeframe: Australia Post aims to resolve complaints within 10 business days for most issues

escalation.timeline: If your postal complaint cannot be resolved you may contact the Postal Industry Ombudsman (part of the Commonwealth Ombudsman)

companies.name: RACQ Insurance Limited
companies.description: Queensland motoring club providing roadside assistance, motor and home insurance, banking and travel services.

steps: For general enquiries call RACQ on 13 1905; for insurance claims call 13 7202
Provide membership or policy details and describe your concern; RACQ will log and investigate
If unresolved, request the matter be escalated to a team leader or the Member Relations team
internalProcess.timeframe: RACQ does not publish a specific timeframe but aims to resolve complaints as soon as practicable

escalation.timeline: If your complaint concerns an insurance or banking product and is not resolved you can contact AFCA for an external review

companies.name: EnergyAustralia Pty Ltd
companies.description: Australian electricity and gas retailer serving residential, small business and large commercial customers.

contact.hours: 8am-7pm Monday to Friday (residential); 8am-8pm Monday to Friday (small business); 8am-5pm Monday to Friday (large business)

steps: Call EnergyAustralia’s customer service team on 133 466 (residential), 1800 146 749 (small business) or 1300 362 466 (large business) during business hours
Provide your account number and details of your complaint; EnergyAustralia records your feedback
If you prefer, submit a written complaint using the online form and a complaints handling team member will be in touch
EnergyAustralia reviews the complaint and aims to resolve the issue with you
internalProcess.timeframe: EnergyAustralia states that it will work to resolve complaints within a reasonable time and will respond within several business days

escalation.timeline: If you are still dissatisfied you can contact your state Energy & Water Ombudsman for an external review (e.g., EWOV in Victoria, EWON in NSW, or EIOS in South Australia)
